alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 10:36AM CDT until May 09 at 8:42AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Missouri River at Hermann. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Missouri River at St. Charles. Missouri River at Washington. Missouri River near Chamois. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Missouri River at St. Charles. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, The Katy Trail begins flooding near this height along Hawning Road, about 2 miles north northeast of the Highway 370 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 26.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Friday was 26.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.7 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg 1 pm Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Missouri River St. Charles 25.0 26.6 26.3 23.9 22.9 22.4 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
